result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavana R Marx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders Huber with standard release conditions.
Within the First 10 Days defendant to establish contact with a 12 step program and be released from Huber to attend the 12 step program 2 times per week.

Straight Time (Jail).
Credit For Time Served 39 days.

miscConds.notes:
Cash Bail Applied.  Costs and Surcharges and remaining balances on this charge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  To be paid and/or 136 hours of Community Service to be completed by the end of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, complete all conditions of Probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Obtain valid driver's license within 4 months.
Be involved in a 12 step program within 30 days and to obtain a sponsor/mentor.

Atty. Fragoso requests a restitution hearing.  If parties agree upon an amount prior to a Restitution Hearing the parties to send in a letter and Court Orders that the amount is to be paid back as a Condition of Probation with the First payment due on 04-15-2015.  Restitution to be paid before costs.
03/30/2015 PER HEARING, RESTITUTION IS SET TO ZERO.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.

Defendant Lavana R Marx in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is requesting remaining sentence be with Huber release.  Argument by Atty. Fragoso.  State takes no position.
Court believes a transcript needs to be ordered to review the circumstances of the sentencing hearing.  Defense notes the release date in late October.

Court orders Huber with Standard Release Conditions commence on 8-15-15.  Within the first 10 days defendant to establish contact with a 12 step program and be released from Huber to attend the 12 step program 2 times per week.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.

Return of Officer

Attorney Sam Benedict for Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant Lavana R Marx did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No other appearances.

Court sets restitution at $0.00.
Restitution hearing on March 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lavana R Marx in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

9 months  Jail   STRAIGHT TIME (Credit - 39 days)   

Term of Probation: 2 Years  

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Obtain valid driver's license within 4 months;
- Be involved in a 12 step program within 30 days and to obtain a sponsor/mentor;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

Costs: $243.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00

Condition Time: 30 days Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion.

COUNT 2

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

9 months  Jail   STRAIGHT TIME  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1

Term of Probation: 2 Years  CONCURRENT TO COUNT1

Conditions of Probation:  SAME AS COUNT 1

Costs: $243.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00

COUNT 3

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

9 months  Jail   STRAIGHT TIME  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1

Term of Probation: 2 Years  CONCURRENT TO COUNT1

Conditions of Probation: SAME AS COUNT 1

Costs: $243.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00


Costs and Surcharges:  BAIL TO APPLY Remaining to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid and/or 136 hours of community service to be completed by the end of probation. 

Atty. Fragoso requests a restitution hearing. If parties agree upon an amount prior to a restitution hearing the parties to send in a letter and court orders that the amount is to be paid back as a condition of probation with the first payment due on 4-15-15.  Restitution is to be paid before costs. 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, complete all conditions of probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
